intro: Poa compta, commonly known as slender meadowgrass, is a perennial grass species native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along stream banks. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are usually less than 10 millimeters wide, and it produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Poa compta plays an important role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
